page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: Being part of the Furness Peninsular our block has a varied geology comprising limestoneand slate.The highest part of our area consists of low,rounded,glaciated hills,containing many deep tree-lined gills.Many of the upland valleys have been flooded to provide reservoirs for urban areas.The moorland areas are used mainly for sssssheep grazing but the lower slopes for pasture,dairy and beef farming.Very little land is used for arable farming.The arae is transected by the Barrow-Lancaster railway and the A590 trunk road,both major transport routes.The housing is varied,spanning from traditional stone cottages to modern bungalows.At present much building is taking place,but many locals resent the new estates for fear of loosing the areas' rural character.
